title: Seamus Coleman undergoes successful surgery on broken leg as Martin O'Neill hails defender's mental strength
text:
Sport Seamus Coleman undergoes successful surgery on broken leg as Martin O'Neill hails defender's mental strength The Everton defender was stretchered off during the draw with Wales after a shocking challenge from Neil Taylor Share Coleman is stretchered off against Wales (Photo: PA Wire) Share Get daily   Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Martin O'Neill has confirmed Seamus Coleman has undergone successful surgery on his broken leg. 
The Everton defender suffered a double fracture after a horror challenge from Neil Taylor in Friday's draw between Republic of Ireland and Wales. 
Coleman is set to be out for a minimum of six months but has already started his long road to rehabilitation. 
O'Neill said: "He had the operation yesterday (Saturday) morning at 8:30am, that was successful. 
"He has realised everything that has happened and is obviously very disappointed. Taylor clatters into Coleman (Photo: Sportsfile via Getty Images) Coleman receives treatment (Photo: Stephen McCarthy/Sportsfile) Seamus Coleman is stretchered off (Photo: AFP) 
"It will take some time to heal, it's a double break but it has been pinned up now and screwed in. 
"I know the doctors and surgeons are all very, very pleased with the way the operation has gone and now it's time for recuperation. 
"I saw him the evening of the injury, he was fairly groggy. It's a devastating blow for the lad, he was having a phenomenal season at his club and a phenomenal season for us as captain." Republic of Ireland manager Martin O'Neill (Photo: REUTERS) 
O'Neill went on to suggest Coleman's mental strength will boost his comeback. 
"Sometimes there are complications afterwards and injuries can be more prolonged, other times it can be clean and clear sailing. 
"It will take some time but Seamus has great determination and sometimes those things work very much in your favour, in terms of recovery." Like us on Facebook
